1.definition: a lump or mass of hard consolidated mineral matter
examples: he threw a rock at me

2.definition: building material consisting of a piece of rock hewn in a definite shape for a special purpose
examples: he wanted a special stone to mark the site

3.definition: material consisting of the aggregate of minerals like those making up the Earth's crust
examples: stone is abundant in New England and there are many quarries

4.definition: a crystalline rock that can be cut and polished for jewelry
examples: he had the gem set in a ring for his wife
she had jewels made of all the rarest stones

5.definition: an avoirdupois unit used to measure the weight of a human body; equal to 14 pounds
examples: a heavy chap who must have weighed more than twenty stone

6.definition: the hard inner (usually woody) layer of the pericarp of some fruits (as peaches or plums or cherries or olives) that contains the seed
examples: you should remove the stones from prunes before cooking

7.definition: United States jurist who was named chief justice of the United States Supreme Court in 1941 by Franklin D. Roosevelt (1872-1946)

10.definition: United States journalist who advocated liberal causes (1907-1989)

11.definition: United States jurist who served on the United States Supreme Court as chief justice (1872-1946)

13.definition: a lack of feeling or expression or movement
examples: her face was as hard as stone
he must have a heart of stone
People wanted to stone the woman who had a child out of wedlock

16.definition: of any of various dull tannish or grey colors
